intro: Oenanthe jordanii, commonly known as Jordanian hemlock, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and sometimes toxic plants. The plant features slender, hollow stems and small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, often aromatic scent. Oenanthe jordanii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks.
